action.action-desc: Ms. Mace (for herself, Mr. Nehls, Mr. Donalds, and Ms. Boebert) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to provide for certain rules for housing or transportation based on gender and to provide for a limitation on gender-related medical treatment.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Prison Rape Prevention Act of 2025.

section.header: Rules for housing or transportation based on gender; limitation on gender-affirming care
section.text: Section 3621 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Rules for housing or transportation based on gender; limitation on gender-Affirming care
subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Bureau of Prisons—

paragraph.text: shall ensure that a prisoner is placed, during that prisoner’s term of imprisonment, only among prisoners of the same biological sex as the prisoner;
shall ensure that a prisoner, when transported in the company of other prisoners, is only transported among prisoners of the same biological sex as the prisoner; and
may not furnish or pay for any gender-related medical treatment.
The term biological sex means the biological determination as to whether an individual is male or female.

The term female means an individual who naturally has, had, will have, or would have, but for a developmental or genetic anomaly or historical accident, the reproductive system that at some point produces, transports, and utilizes eggs for fertilization.

The term male means an individual who naturally has, had, will have, or would have, but for a developmental or genetic anomaly or historical accident, the reproductive system that at some point produces, transports, and utilizes sperm for fertilization.

clause.text: males, females, or the natural differences between males and females, unless such term is otherwise specified or used alone (rather than with or as an adjective modifying other words); and

subparagraph.text: does not mean a synonym for terms or ideas such as gender identity, experienced gender, gender expression, or gender roles

clause.text: with respect to a female individual, medical treatments provided for purposes of addressing the perception of such individual that the gender or sex of such individual is not female, including—

item.text: implantation of erection or testicular protheses;

subclause.text: exogenous doses of testosterone or other androgens;

item.text: synthetic drugs that suppress the production of estrogen and progesterone or delay or suppress pubertal development in female individuals; and

subclause.text: such other medical treatment, identified by the Director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons, that may be provided for purposes of addressing the perception of such individual that the gender or sex of such individual is not female; and

clause.text: with respect to a male individual, medical treatments provided for purposes of addressing the perception of such individual that the gender or sex of such individual is not male, including—

item.text: synthetic drugs that suppress the production of testosterone or delay or suppress pubertal development in male individuals; and

subclause.text: such other medical treatment, identified by the Director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons, that may be provided for purposes of addressing the perception of such individual that the gender or sex of such individual is not male; and

subparagraph.text: does not include any medical treament performed on an individual for the purposes of treating—

clause.text: a disorder of sex development, diagnosed by a physician after such physician has determined through genetic or biochemical testing that such individual does not have normal sex chromosome structure, sex steroid hormone production, or sex steroid hormone action;
irresolvably ambiguous biological sex characteristics of such individual, including the presence of—

subclause.text: both ovarian and testicular tissue; or

clause.text: an infection, injury, disease, or disorder caused or exacerbated by gender-related medical treatment that was furnished to an individual.
